content: The Act may be cited as the "Minuteman Missile National Historic Site Establishment Act of 1999". Congress finds that the Minuteman II intercontinental ballistic missile launch control facility and launch facilities Delta 1 and Delta 9 are significant examples of American history during the Cold War, symbolizing dedication and preparedness of Air Force missileers in remote locations. The Minuteman II intercontinental ballistic missile launch control facility and launch facilities Delta 1 and Delta 9 symbolize the dedication and preparedness of Air Force missileers during the Cold War. These facilities offer a unique opportunity to illustrate the history and significance of the Cold War, the arms race, and ICBM development, as the National Park System lacks a unit specifically commemorating this era. The Act aims to preserve and interpret the Minuteman II missile defense system's structures, highlighting its historical role in America's strategic commitment to world peace during the Cold War. The National Park System lacks a unit specifically dedicated to commemorating this era. The Act aims to preserve and interpret the historical role of the Minuteman II missile defense system in America's strategic commitment to world peace during the Cold War. It also aims to complement interpretive programs offered by the South Dakota Air and Space Museum. The Minuteman Missile National Historic Site is established to preserve the historical role of the Minuteman II missile defense system during the Cold War. The Minuteman Missile National Historic Site is established in South Dakota as a unit of the National Park System, consisting of the Minuteman II ICBM launch control facilities. The Minuteman Missile National Historic Site in South Dakota includes the Minuteman II ICBM launch control facilities depicted as "Delta 1 Launch Control Facility" and "Delta 9 Launch Facility". The Secretary is authorized to make minor adjustments to the boundary of the historic site, which includes the Minuteman II ICBM launch control facility known as "Delta 9 Launch Facility". The site will be administered in accordance with this Act and National Park System laws. Authorization of Appropriations: Such sums necessary for carrying out this Act are authorized to be appropriated. The Secretary of the Air Force shall transfer funds specifically appropriated for land maintenance in fiscal year 1999 to establish and maintain a historic site. This Act does not impact funds available for the Legacy Resource Management Program.
